Reviews.Title: “Good Old Style hotel”
Reviews.Author: MJ_London
Reviews.Content: 1st visit to Istanbul, We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in March, We booked via lastminute.com and were given a corner room with not much view, but to be honest, Istanbul is such a wonderful and beautiful city, who cares what view you have from your hotel room. IMHO, it is more a mediocre 4 star than a 5 star. The bed was a memory foam mattress and was a surprisingly comfortable sleep. The room and bathroom were very well equipped and had a jacuzzi. The hotel staff seemed to be pleasant enough, but we didn't have any reason to have to face them in a bad mood. The tram is just down the road and was incredibly convenient for 2TRY (approx 70p) We found an amazing little cafe about 5 doors down from the hotel (Gulen) where you can dine out for nothing, and 2 doors down from there, was a lovely little cafe which had lovely pastry type things (only ever seen in Turkey) Down the road in the opposite direction (on the way to the tram) there is also a lovely patisserie called Limon, which I would highly recommend.. very helpful and the cake was gorgeous. All in all, the hotel was lovely for us and I would imagine will be a great place to go in the summer as there is a lovely roof top pool and terrace. MJ

Reviews.Title: “We stayed there 2 times over the holidays...”
Reviews.Author: SallyCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way through Istanbul, and like it so much, we rebooked on our way back. The location is perfect for those who want to walk to sights like Topkapi, very convenient to public transportation, and we liked being further from the bridges. The hotel is very nice, it is well-kept, quiet, the breakfast abundant but not super tasty, the staff are quirky and fun, the guests upscale. We had a sumptuous massage onsite. The Lobby bar is warm, and the food very good, the coffees amazing & welcome at this time of year. We would definitely recommend the hotel, and would stay there again. There is no great food in this part of Istanbul, but we found food in Istanbul lacking in general, so our advice is to stick with the fresh fish--assuming you are prepared to pay top dollar for it. Our main issue with this hotel is communication. We booked our first reservation online, had to change the reservation, called multiple times, never got a re-confirmation, but they did have our reservation with changes upon arrival. They did not send send the airport transfer, and did not let us know this, but we half expected this to happen anyway. Our real problem was that we booked 1 night at check-out for the next week, added another night via call, called 3x to confirm, we could not get this confirmed, so had to pay a very expensive rate for the second night upon arrival...and they would not adjust the price. They tried to put us in one of the lesser rooms on the back side of the hotel, but then moved us into a fab suite. So all in all, this is Turkey, the people are friendly and interesting, they try their best to be accommodating, they have trouble with phone & email communication, but try to keep you as happy as possible. One more thing, avoid all the organized tours and meals through the concierge, you can do much better price-wise on your own. This is a fun hotel, and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Missed opportunity”
Reviews.Author: Wataru69
Reviews.Content: The hotel has everything to be excellent. Nice rooms, jacuzzi in room, free wifi, swimming pools, restaurants, room service... The reality is that many things do not work properly: you have to pay extra to use the bath/jacuzzi in the room, horrible coffee and juice at breakfast, fresh juice at breakfast costs extra, for wifi reception you have to sit against the door of your room, airco blows hot air day and night, food very disappointing. It could be so much better with a little extra effort.

Reviews.Title: “I loved hammam”
Reviews.Author: mariadolores13
Reviews.Content: we are stay 5 nights in Istanbul. we are family.Hotel rooms are very beautiful and very big. Breakfast buffet is excellent.The staff are really nice and friendly.I always travel in Istanbul. it was very comfortable hotel.We will be back hopefully.rooms have a fireplace.excellent location. Looking to the Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “rooms have a fireplace and very big”
Reviews.Author: maisasco
Reviews.Content: cleanliness of the room was excellent breakfast buffet is excellent hotel staff very friendly i loved celal aga konagi

Reviews.Title: “rooms are very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: silommakkasan
Reviews.Content: clean friendly staff we loved hammam it was very comfortable hotel

Reviews.Title: “rooms are very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: nadiaintra
Reviews.Content: hotel rooms are very comfortable hotel satff very helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Decor and service both necessary”
Reviews.Author: JLRsydney
Reviews.Content: Message to hotel management: sumptuous decor is not enough, service needs to be of the same standard to justify the price. Stayed for three nights in mid October, and while the location is great the mood and the food are just ordinary. Once it was clear we were not buying tours or guides through the hotel, all interest in us evaporated. The single rooms are very much smaller than the doubles, but the tariff does not reflect this. The daily room clean was at best perfunctory. I was expecting luxury, but it was a very patchy experience.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel wonderfull stay”
Reviews.Author: Hassan M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Celal Aga KonagÄ± Hotel for one whole week and was absolutely trhilled by the kindness, hospitality and good care provided to us by all of the staff at this wonderful hotel. We have absolutely NOTHING to complain of regarding our stay. Clean, bright and big rooms. WONDERFUL staff and delightful meals. Perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: OLEG S
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel for everyone...perfect location nice and clean kind staff....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Gerhard M
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean room, friendly staff and nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul Hammam massage”
Reviews.Author: RoboRuth
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was average in every way, although the service overall was diligent. The neighbourhood is questionable. Fortunately, we were there only one night and hardly went out because of the rain and cold. A wonderful experience, however, was the Hammam massage I had in the hotel spa. The room where it took place is outstandingly beautiful, and the rubdown itself is not to be missed !

Reviews.Title: “Wants to be a 5 star but ...”
Reviews.Author: TroutNetherlands
Reviews.Content: Great location and beautiful hotel. Rooms were large but in need of maintenance with 4-5 things broken in our two rooms. Front desk alternated between helpful and rude ( hung up on us 3 times when we asked for help). Breakfast was strange ... Large variety but very poor quality coffee and really runny stuff in the buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service. Now just some fine tuning to make it excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Amurray160
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days in early October. Positives: 1.Service - All staff we dealt with spoke English and had a helpful attitude. Also, based upon Comments made here and management response, you can see an effort is being made to correct deficiencies. 2. Rooms - overall very clean and spacious. Beds extremely comfortable when compared to the usually overly firm beds that you tend to find in European hotels. 3. Features- having two swimming pools, the Turkish bath and gym is fantastic. 4. Great location. Short walk to tram for Topkapi Palace and mosques, but could also walk. Grand bazaar is short walk. Need for improvement: 1. Breakfast - was our biggest disappointment. Overall quality still needs to be improved. Jams, Orange juice and coffee need to be greatly improved. (coffee shop located on the corner of the hotel building was a savior.) 2. General maintenance - hot tub worked, but control dials need repair. smoke alarm missing, outdoor pool needed cleaning, would be nice if pools were heated. (realize October is getting to the end of season)

Reviews.Title: “breakfast buffet is excellent”
Reviews.Author: limeunkyung
Reviews.Content: we are stay 4 nights hotel in celal aga. rooms are very beautiful and very big. romms have a fireplace. it is worth the price .

Reviews.Title: “Superb experience and stay!!”
Reviews.Author: aveeks
Reviews.Content: Celal Aga Konagi Hotel in Istanbul is a luxurious experience. Very warm and friendly staff. Located well within the heart of the city. Close to the tourist spots. Bathroom/toilet is fully automatic. You can experience the pleasure of watching a television from the jacuzzi itself. Lovely spread of a typical turkish breakfast.Lot of dry fruits, jiuces, fruits and breads.One will also enjoy the roof top pool and the must try Hamam bath.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK, management below zero.”
Reviews.Author: Guy001
Reviews.Content: Accomodation : worth 5*. Location : very good. I'll make it short. I had to send 2 e-mails and reminder for the reservation of the shuttle from the hotel ( what I was willing to paying for ) confirmed. Received a rather arrogant reply that everything was settled. You guessed it : no show. We were 2 couples of which one with two children. Only 2 towels available EVERY day of the 5 we stayed there. Every day again we had to ask to get it right. No filling of the mini-bar, unless you asked for it. You had to go to the reception to get for the bath lid to be able to use it instead of the shower !!! For a 5* rated hotel, it is unacceptable that they charge you 2 EUR extra for an omelette at breakfast !!! I could carry on, but this is definitely not the style and service I am used to in Instanbul or Turkey in general. Disastrous management.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Great location.”
Reviews.Author: SJperth_8
Reviews.Content: We loved Istanbul and can't wait to return to explore more of Turkey one day. Our stay was very nice partly due to the great location of our hotel. Walking distance to the Grand Bazaar & restaurants. We even walked to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace & Sophia Agia. However it can be done by tram as nearest stop is just around the corner. The hotel itself was nice, clean and comfortable with friendly service. We didn't really enjoy breakfast as it wasn't very fresh & mainly Arabic/Turkish foods with a lack of continental items. The roof top pool was large, plenty of sun lounges, bar, perfect to unwind or relax in the sunshine. All in all can be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “breakfast buffet is excellent”
Reviews.Author: nyotacherika
Reviews.Content: we loved hamam rooms are very beatiful and very big hotel staff very friendly it was very comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “rooms have a firepalace and very big”
Reviews.Author: isaacbashiru
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for a week. pool and hamam wonderful. cleanliness of the room was excellent. rooms have a fireplace and very big. the servise and attitude of all the staff was fantastÄ±c and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “rooms very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mujiburdharot
Reviews.Content: hotel rooms very comfortable and very clean. hotel staffs are very friendley and helpfull. hotel hamam wonderfull. hotel health club excellent. breakfast buffet very choises.thank you

Reviews.Title: “excellent rooms and bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: ziaurprothom
Reviews.Content: we were stay for the business. rooms are very clean and comfortable. bathroom very interesting and very excellent. wc very comfortable:) thank you Celal aga konagi hotel

Reviews.Title: “rooms have a fireplace excellent”
Reviews.Author: elbahohenbihl
Reviews.Content: we are stay 5 nights hotel in june hotel staff very friendly and helpfull we loved hamam and spa rooms very comfortable. rooms have a fireplace. excellent very excellent

Reviews.Title: “excellent and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: bettinaschuett
Reviews.Content: excellent and very comfortable hotel. rooms are very beatiful and very big. we loved hamam and spa. breakfast buffet is excellent. istanbul great city thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Historical Hotel and Turkish bath.”
Reviews.Author: freeoki
Reviews.Content: Stay in May with my family.Turkish bath and swimming pool amazing, staff very freindly and profesinioal.

Reviews.Title: “BEST LOCATION AND VERY MAGNIFICENT ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: Terraces75
Reviews.Content: We are stay 4 nights hotel in May. Rooms very comfortable to stay and jacuzzi very relaxing. Breakfast very modern and quickly service.Walking distance to cold city and grand bazaar. thank you for all

Reviews.Title: “Good location 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: PMRad
Reviews.Content: Good: Clean room,kind staff,new turkish hotel,good location,big beds Bad: Breakfast was as in 3 star hotels,bathroom was modern but some of them out of order !

Reviews.Title: “Great location poor in all other respects”
Reviews.Author: 320rover
Reviews.Content: All in all a real let down after getting hopes up. The hotel location is good and standard of facilities of rooms are good too. The let down is nearly all but a few of the staff. Only a couple of bar staff and friendly doorman make this bearable the rest treat you with ill respect and show no customer service skills or willingness to care. If you can put up with be disrespected and not talking or hoping for help from the staff this will do. The food is also is of a poor standard, to western standards anyhow! Most rooms are loud but thats just due to the Istanbul traffic crisis!

Reviews.Title: “BEST LOCATION BEST SERVICE REALLY A 5 STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: renaaslann
Reviews.Content: This is my second time in istanbul.This hotel is more than i was expected.The rooms are very big ;the breakfast buffet is excellent;indoor and outdoor pools are amazing.Hamam is wonderful .The staff is helpfull .I think location is perfect.10 minutes to taxim square 3 minutes to sultanahmet area.5 STAR SERVICE 5 STAR FACILITIES Thank you Celal Aga Konagi Hotel ..

Reviews.Title: “MAGNIFICIENT HOTEL EXCELLENT SERVICE AMAZING STAFF”
Reviews.Author: josephinessss
Reviews.Content: I always travel in istanbul.But its the first time i stayed at this hotel.When i came the lobby i saw the perfect decor of the hotel.The reception staff Beycan Gurhan Cengiz were really helpfull .I stayed at the standard room but it was like suite room or like an executive.It was an enourmous room.At the bathroom there were double jakuzzi and a shower.In the room there were tempur bed 'i was shocked because its really luxuary for a hotel .The indoor and outdoor pools are amazing.And the hamam was perfect .I like the spa staff also .The price of the hotel is very cheap for a hotel like that . Breakfast buffet is also good .Thank u so much .I will come again .

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT a 5* standard”
Reviews.Author: asTOMas
Reviews.Content: 1. Reception - well welcomed, cooperative, English language knowledge should be a must for a 5* hotel reception staff. Ms Tuna Emren - the customer service manager is very nice, friendly and customer need focused person. She had open ear for our constructive feedback. We have been also offered by vouchers for hamman (which we unfortunately have not used - due to the busy program) 2. Room - big, but a bit dark, the wording from the hotel's web.site "Each room features luxurious jacuzzi and a separate shower" is rather misleading. We got a room where the window between bathroom and room itself was cracked (this should not happen in a 5* hotel), the bath tube was not clean (in the hidden edges was quite old dirt) and did not have a bath tube plug (and once we got one, it did not fit properly, so we had to ask for another one and this could be used only manually...). The "luxurious jacuzzi" was extremely loud so that no proper conversation could be held... Once we started the jacuzzi the clear water turned into a bit milky water (the question is when the jacuzzi was cleaned properly; we have not used it after that experience anymore...). The towels were extremely washed out. 3. Breakfest - VERY POOR quality. No fresh fruits but apples (having mentioned this we noticed fresh fruit salat on the very last day of our 5 days stay). The orange juice with syntetic taste and coffee from the vending machine was rather disgusting. To ask for 2EUR extra charge for a fresh orange juice and fresh omelet is not acceptable in the 5* hotel. The marmalades ware also not eatable. (PLEASE take an inspiration at NamlÄ± Gourmet Shop in KarakÃ¶y where we had our breakfasts...) 4. Animal rights - Having seen the "Blue-and-yellow Macaw (Ara ararauna)" in the darkest corner of the -1 Floor (breakfast room) I was astonished how is that possible to keep such a beautiful parrot in a approx. 1m x 1.5m x 1.5m cage WITHOUT any possibility to fly. The poor bird is sitting in that cage for already 2! years. Please note it is a living animal not a plastic attraction!!! Please arrange for a better place of living for this parrot. 5. Location is great! Ease reachable - walking distance to major Istanbul highlights. 6. Summarised: Celal Aga Konagi Hotel is definitely NOT a 5* hotel standard. Based on my travel experience it could be a good 3* hotel (but not more). In general we were disappointed but did not wanted to destroy our Easter holidays due to this experience ( we just made the best out of it).

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service, Outstanding Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sightseers_11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at here for 3 nights and 4 days for a short getaway. The service was simply exceptional and our room was great. The hotel offers some great services to help you relax. The hotel itself is only about 15 minutes walking distance to the Grand Bazaar and about 25 minutes from Hagia Sophia and other great attractions. Located just around the corner from the hotel is a wonderful restaurant, the Istanbul Fish and Steak House. Great food, great people! To the hotel manager, Mr, Karakus, Thanks for a great weekend your staff and hotel provided exceptional service! In short, my wife and I WILL be returning to this hotel in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great quality, is like a second home!”
Reviews.Author: iabbiech
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the celal aga konagi every year since they open, i consider this hotel to be a true home away from home! the rooms are spacious, well decorated, nice and comfortable, specialy the beds, they are big and soft. The bathrooms are big and very modern and well equipped. Everyone that work at the hotel are very friendly and always try to help as needed, The food is good and there is variety. The hotel is very well located, definitely for me is the best choice in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect sleeping!”
Reviews.Author: frofch
Reviews.Content: The matrasses and the room size is very good. I liked also breakfast and the bathroom. there is also a jacuzi. But check first if it works. A very good price and quality balance.

Reviews.Title: “Never had to leave $10.00 deposit for a bath plug in a 5* Hotel before”
Reviews.Author: go2mike
Reviews.Content: We had a few days free from work and found a great deal on Expedia Unpublished Rate Hotels for a 5* hotel but could not see name until booked of course. The location is great, and we had a fantastic welcome at arrival when the booking could not be found. They checked us in never less and said it would be sorted the next day, that is very unusual plus they did not take a credit card, but then it started going downhill very quick. It's an old hotel, decor very overdone, but could be said fun and it is really set up for the mass tourists business. The location in the old town and next to the Grand Bazaar is good, but the service after check in, especially in the restaurant and reception is not what I know in Turkey. I can say this as I am a person who travels allot in Turkey and the service was not typical of Turkey at all. Rooms are big and you get a tempur mattress and pillow in the deluxe room which is a node touch but if you want to use the large jacuzzi bath tub you must pay $10.00 deposit for the plug. The bath leaked over the bathroom floor and also there was no heat in the bedrooms (was broken) but a nice fake effect fire burning fireplace but no heat in it. Not the two day break we wanted but this is unusual for Expedia

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star! I've stayed in hostels with better service that this!”
Reviews.Author: ZATraveller12345
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel for two nights with my wife and was extremely disappointed. Apart from the reasonable nightly rate, this hotel is easily one of the worst I have ever stayed in. Read the reviews - this is not a 5 star hotel. It's old, shabby and sad. If in fact this is a five star hotel, then why are you charged 12 Euros for a second key. If you were planning on using the in-room Jacuzzi, be ready to purchase, yes purchase, a water stopper for 10 USD. Fancy an omelet, pay an addition 2 Euros. Things that come standard when you think of a 3, 4 or 5 star hotel are totally absent here. The cleaning service is extremely poor. Good luck getting them to change your towels or actually make the bed. The cleaning lady would straighten the sheets and pillows and then stuff the duvet between the bed and bed-side table. This hotel is much more of a hostel and far and NOT A 5-Star hotel. Because it has a spa, swimming pool and fitness center, I would not give it more than 3 stars. There are many other hotels in the area, shop around before you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “This is NOT a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tigerlily999
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel and it was definitely not a 5 star hotel. 1.) There was no plug for the bathtub (we had to call for one). 2.) One woman at reception was exceptionally rude. My friend called down to ask how we could turn off the heat in our room (it was so hot and stuffy and we weren't comfortable) and we were told the air conditioner was broken. My friend asked when it would be fixed and she replied, "I am not a technician, how should I know? We will send a technician." The technician never came and we subsiquentially found out nothing was broken, they just control the temperature in all the rooms by one central unit. Needless to say, we had a hot/stuffy room for 3 days (we were told that it is cold outside so the heat was needed!). 3.) Problem with wiring. The light switch sent the blind covering the large window between the bathroom and the beds (?? weird in itself) to open. Only one electrical outlet worked on one side of the bed. The electronic toilet did not work at all. Our electronic room key (controls the lights) would suddenly stop working causing all the lights to go off. 4.) Windows are not double-glazed so very noisy. 5.) Breakfast was average (again, not 5 star). The rooms were clean and the beds were adequate. The location is good for exploring the old part of the city. Not all of the staff were rude but the level of service was absolutely not 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “worst 5 star hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: americansam
Reviews.Content: Had a terrible stay at this hotel. Most definitely not a five star establishment. Upon check in I was informed that the hotel was overbooked and I that I had to go to a nearby hotel. I had read past reviews about this happening so was very skeptical. I told them that I would not go to another hotel and that I demanded either a refund or they pay for me to stay at another 5 star hotel of my choice. A few minutes later a room at the hotel magically became available for me and I was able to check in. I was shocked when I entered the room, it was drab, worn down and very depressing. My city view was a view of the dirty street below. And since when is it acceptable to put memory foam mattresses in hotel rooms. I think I would have slept better on the floor. Hardly slept all night as I was in pain from the mattress. Also the windows are not double glazed with the street outside being very noisy. At the buffet breakfast I struggled to find something mildly appealing to eat. Hotel while being located near some of the big sites is in a very undesirable location. No nice restaurants, cafes or bars nearby and it isn't really safe to walk around the neighborhood especially at night. Hotel concierge could not provide me with a local map. not sure why they even bother having a guy there. I hope that other travelers don't make the same mistake as myself.

Reviews.Title: “great rooms very spacious and great beds”
Reviews.Author: hadji786
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights at the celal konagi hotel at Istanbul. Great city. The hotel is nearby the tram station with is easy to travel to the major sight seeings. The rooms are very specious with great two 2 person-beds. There is a extra cost for the use of the jacuzzi 16 euro and unfortunately one side of the jacuzzi was not working. The hotel has a swimming pool which is warmed and open till late and has a small fitness room and several showers and steam rooms. We enjoyed staying at this hotel and I will return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked - so what! It's not our problem...”
Reviews.Author: PedePrint
Reviews.Content: We had been looking forward to staying at this hotel, but it was overbooked when we arrived! So after a long wait, we were driven to another hotel. After a night at that hotel we were then driven back to this hotel again. It just was not exactly what we wanted, but Celal Aga Konagi Hotel desired in any way to excuse that we did not get what we had paid for. So neither an apology or compensation, despite the fact that we have the first night stayed at a hotel that cost a fifth of what we had paid. Very very disappointing. And just to finish, so the hotel's haman had no available appointments within 3 days. Wellness and spa area was very boring, and the light did not work in half the area. Finally, breakfast buffet, some of the dullest I have ever experienced. It may well be that the hotel has 5 stars but it should not have more than a maximum 3. I could never recommend this hotel to anyone not even my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish atmosphere with European comfort”
Reviews.Author: Anna188628
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at the Celal Aga hotel: nice location (all Istanbul highlights within 30 minutes walk), wide room with all the comfort, even fireplace!, excellent breakfast, beautiful historical hammam, very nice swimming pool with sauna, snowcave, modern fitness, good restaurant. The guest relation team is always reachable, speaks also English and Dutch and can arrange everything for you. We missed tea or coffee facilities in our room, that should be very nice. Hotel highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice to have everything at hand”
Reviews.Author: ibujoreanu
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in for 5 full days and was not sorry for that. Even when passing by other hotels I said to myself what an excellent choice I made to stay here. The hotel has almost everything one needs to feel comfortable. Staff pays attention to what I am asking for and brings everything one needs when asked. Very helpful in giving information on visiting the city. Excellent breakfast (wide range of cheese and other tasty all culture foods). The restaurant can offer European cuisine although, in most visited places I found different sorts of kebab. I had a refreshing sleep time and could take advantage of a health massage appointment, but had too many in my schedule for the day and couldn't go there. The fitness center is great and the special exotic showers are funny. I could have even a tour of the hotel to see all facilities they offer and can tell you there is everything I can imagine. The important thing is to be patient and wait for any of your problems to be solves. Being in a hurry does not serve anybody. And, in the end, I want to praise the bathroom. Big space, jacuzzi bathtub with all conveniences, valuable series of soap, shampoo, gel douche, etc. The automated washing-drying closet captured my attention also. In a few words, this is to be experienced by everybody coming to visit Istanbul because it is close to the main touristic attractions there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, shame about the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: ex_sirena
Reviews.Content: It would have been a great experience, if it were not for the terrible service at the hotel restaurant. After we ordered dinner (nothing complicated there, just a couple of salads, a pizza and drinks), we waited for one and a half hours to get our food. In the meantime, nobody came to our table to let us know that a delay in the service was expected, let alone apologize for it. There was a young child with us who was desperate for his dinner after a long day of sight-seeing. When our waiter finally turned up and we complained, he apologized, but our evening was already ruined. When you pay for a five-star hotel, you do expect a five-star treatment, not this shoddy and unprofessional service, and not people wasting your time for no apparent reason. This was enough for us to decide that the hotel was not worth returning to and we would most definitely not recommend the place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in a luxurious Top Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrankMeijer
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Calal Aga Konagi Hotel in december 2010 was very pleasant. We felt very confortable in the beautifull classical decorated Hotel wiht many original historcal element. A historical white marber Hammam, a nice swimmingpool with sauna and turkisch bath made the stay even on an rainy day nice. Our room had a double jacuzzi with was very comfortable after a busy day of sightseeing. The personal was friendly and helpfull so all our requests were directly taken into action. Over all it was a very nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lavish”
Reviews.Author: TonyFerrari
Reviews.Content: Really felt relaxed and at home here. Friendly staff, who were always very helpful. Beautifully appointed rooms with good size bathroom and Jacuzzi. TV could do with better tuning but then again I didnâ€™t really use it that much so didnâ€™t report it. Very comfortable beds. Make sure that you get the soft goose down pillows. Loved the fact that thereâ€™s a piano in the foyer, that is a great plus for me. Good central location, close to Grand Bazaar and tram. 20 minute walk to Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. It was noisy with the window open, on our second visit due to nearby building work but this will just be a passing phase and was OK with the window closed. Had breakfast in the room several times. This was excellent. WiFi Internet could be a bit patchy but overall OK. Looking forward to using the rooftop pool in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need to relax , if Istambul leaves time for it”
Reviews.Author: Bilwi043
Reviews.Content: Don't pay for a Turkish bath, a complete spa and jacuzzi in rooms if you're not going to enjoy them; the city takes all your time! But it's nice to know you have them, just in case. The location is very convenient. Family rooms are huge and beds are very comfortable. Rooms on the street side a bit noisy. The only downside is breakfast at rush hour. Staff couldn't cope and the breakfast room is too small for so many people at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Big Idea”
Reviews.Author: geoffrun
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel as it is historic & would also provide some luxury plus importantly for us the use of gym (running out side in this city is not easy) & swimmimg pools. The pool facilities where on the surface good, the indoor pool was a good hotel pool being 20 metres in lenghth. The hotel advertised that it opened at 8.30am, this only happened on one ocassion the time was revised to 10.30am. We have stayed in many hotels around the world and with this one exception have always been able to swim prior to breakfast (as many do). We cannot comment on the roof top pool as the weather was never suitable to try it out. The pool usage is not our only complaint, on returning to room (which was as described) we found that it had not been cleaned properly or items replenished i.e.coffee. The reception manager did arrange to have the room recleaned while were out, this was only a partial success. The room cleaning remained at this standard for our stay of four nights, they also seemed unable to grasp that cleaning the bathroom is fine but the use of a toilet cleanser is often necessary The hotel boasts a number of resurants & bars all of which were unwelcoming as they were so brightly lit. During our stay we rarely saw more than a handful of people eating/drinking in the hotel. The resturants in general we more welcoming and much more suttle. The hotel is quite lavish on arrival and so was our room furnishings, a pity more attention has not been given to customer needs. We enjoyed Istanbul but not the hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced - lazy service, furnishings not working properly”
Reviews.Author: J0_mc
Reviews.Content: 1. Was the hotel close to things (e.g. transport, attractions, restaurants)? About 10min walk to trams, 20min walk to sights like the Hagia Sofia. Many restaurants nearby. 2. Was the hotel in a safe area? Yes. 3. Was there much noise at night? Noise from the local mosque and busy road were quite loud at times. We had a room facing onto the main street. I'd have expected double glazing for the price of the room. 4. What was the quality and cleanliness of the hotel furniture and fittings like (e.g. bed, lock-up safe, shower)? Very elegant and romantic, mainly good quality and clean. Unfortunately some small details were ignored, such as the hot tap for the jacuzzi getting so hot you couldn't touch it without a towel to cover your hand to turn it off, and no instructions for how to convert bath to shower. Also a light in the bathroom was not working, dimming the whole place. The cleaner did not clean up or replace supplies in the tea making area. 5. Do the hotel staff provide a good service (e.g. competence, attitude, availability)? Very difficult to have room service understand my order in English (meatballs dish and a corkscrew for a bottle of wine we already had in our room). I would have thought that plenty of English speakers stayed here, and overall English seems widely spoken throughout Istanbul. After checkout we waited in the lobby for a transfer we'd arranged for ourselves. After 30mins of non-arrival i asked reception to phone to company and check it was OK for us. After calling, the receptionist said he was waiting for the company to call him back before he could know where the driver was. After another 20min waiting, and obviously no return call to reception, i returned to ask the receptionist to call the company again. This time he told me that there would be no transfer and the company had told him to flag us down a taxi instead. Although the problem with the transfer wasn't the receptionist's fault, i feel that he should have been more proactive calling them when they didn't call him back, as this wasted 20min of our time. Eventually we only just got to the airport on time. 6. What were the hotel amenities like (e.g. breakfast, restaurant, pool, bar, car parking)? Good breakfast spread, but details missed. I arrived halfway through breakfast hours to find no clean glasses, bowls or spoons available, and cereal stale. I recieved these items after requesting them. On the 2nd day there was no cold milk for cereal, despite it being the start of the breakfast hours. After requesting milk we were provided with what tasted like sour milk. I would have expected not to have to worry about these things for the price i paid. Also, pool area was unshaded - no umbrellas, and for some reason the music was turned up to 'blast' level at about 10.30am when there was only 2 of us there and i was obviously reading. 7. Did the room come with extras (e.g. minibar, TV, internet, air-con, tea making facility)? Minibar available - on the morning of our 2nd day staff visited to check if the minibar was up to date, and insisted on checking even after i said i hadn't used anything. TV reception was poor and i couldn't get an English speaking channel, although the TV guide said they were there. Tea making facilities in room not updated after the 1st day - used cups left by cleaner and tea bag not replaced. Complimentary bottle of wine bought to room by concierge, but no corkscrew available. Air con fine. 8. Other / general comments: This hotel just seems sloppy and customer service wasn't great. A lot more is expected for the price we paid.

HotelInfo.Name: Celal Aga Konagi Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Balaban Aga Mh. Sehzadebasi Cd. | Eminonu, Istanbul, Turkey
